poem:
### A Call Across the Lines

In the fog of morning paper,  
words slip like fish  
through fingers of newsprint—  
Trump dialing across vast steppes,  
whispering through wires,  
Putin listening to echoes,  
the globe spins from war to word,  
and we sip coffee,  
watching peace hitchhike  
on the quiet trails of thought.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump says he has spoken with Putin about ending Ukraine war Donald Trump has said he held talks with the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, over a negotiated end of the three year Russia-Ukraine war, indicated that Russian negotiators want to meet with US counterparts. Trump told the New York Post that he had spoken to Putin, remarking that “I better not say” just how many times. In comments to the outlet on Friday aboard Air". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
